title: Is reading the source of knowledge? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. In normal English usage, ‘the X’ implies that either a frame of reference which highlights this particular X has been established, or that X is the only X. Since there is no evident frame of reference for this question, it seems to imply the latter. Reading is not the only source of knowledge, though, so I am forced to answer ‘no’. It is a source, but not the source. Other sources include direct experience, non-written forms of communication, logical deduction or inference, intuitive leaps, and observation.

It depends, but Benjamin Franklin taught himself when he was a child by reading. Even in his older years he kept teaching himself by reading and experimenting. As the saying goes “Reading, ‘Riting, and ‘rithmetic, and everything else can be learned by Reading.”
